TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
49 Vita sancti Kenelmi. Regis.
SEint Kenelm þe ȝongue kyng &punctelev; þat holi martyr is
he was kyng in Engelonde &punctelev; of þe Marche of Walis
Kyng kenulf Kenulf his fader hiet &punctelev; he was kyng þare also
Þe Abbeie abbeie of wynchecoumbe Wynchcoumbe he liet arere &punctelev; And þareinne monekes do
And Aftur is deþe he was þare ibured &punctelev; and ȝeot he lijth þere
In þe Abbeiȝe abbeiȝe þat ȝeot &slong;tant &punctelev; þat he himseolf liet arere
Þo was wynchecombe Wynchcombe gret cite &punctelev; and me&slong;t of inovȝ
Of al þulke half of Engelonde &punctelev; so feo&rrot; so his lond d&rrot;ouȝ
Fyf kingues þare weren þulke tyme &punctelev; In engelonde ido
Fo&rrot; Enguelond was guod and long &punctelev; and sumdel b&rrot;od also
Abouten eiȝte hond&rrot;et mile &punctelev; Engelond long is
Fram[MS. fran] þe South into þe No&rrot;th &punctelev; and to hound&rrot;et b&rrot;od iwis
Fram þe E&slong;t into þe We&slong;t &punctelev; also þareinne beoth
Manie wateres guode inowe &punctelev; þat men al dai iseoth
bote þreo wateres p&rrot;incipales &punctelev; of alle ne beoth iwis
Þat .on. is homber Homber þat oþur seuerne Seuerne &punctelev; and temes Temes þe þridde is
To þe No&rrot;thse hombur Hombur geth &punctelev; þat is on of þe be&slong;te
And Temese into þe e&slong;tse &punctelev; and seuerne Seuerne into þe we&slong;te
¶Þeos fijf kyngus of Engelonde &punctelev; þat weren bi olde dawe
hadden heo&rrot;e part ech bi himseolf ideld &punctelev; ase it was riȝt and lawe
Þe kyng þat was of þe March &punctelev; he hadde al þat be&slong;te
Muche del he hadde of Engelond &punctelev; þat on half albi we&slong;te
Wyrece&slong;treschire and warewikeschire Warewikeshire &punctelev; and þe schire of glouce&slong;tre Gloucestre
Þat is neiȝwat al o bischop&rrot;iche &punctelev; þe bischopes of
wyrece&slong;tre Wyrecestre
he hadde þarto cha&slong;treschire Chastreshire &punctelev; and derbischire Derbischire also
And &slong;taffo&rrot;dschire Staffordschire þat beoth alle &punctelev; to[al. in] one bischoperiche ido
In þe bischopriche of Cha&slong;tre &punctelev; and ȝeot heo beoth þarto
Schrobbeschire sum &punctelev; and warewykeschire Warewykeschire haluendel also
Þis king hadde also herefo&rrot;deschire Herefordeschire &punctelev; þat o bischop&rrot;iche is
Ake Schrobschire fallez haluendel &punctelev; to þulke schire[al. bischop&rrot;iche] iwis
And sum of warewikeschire Warewikeschire &punctelev; and of glouce&slong;treschire Gloucestreschire also
Sethþe hadde þe king of þe March &punctelev; wel mo&rrot;e lond þerto
No&rrot;ehampteschire and bokinghamschire Bokinghamschire &punctelev; and þe schire of Oxenfo&rrot;d
Leyce&slong;treschire . lincolneschire Lincolneschire &punctelev; and þe schire of hertfo&rrot;d Hertford
Þat is al o bischop&rrot;iche &punctelev; þat of lincolne Lincolne nouþe is
Þat ȝwuylene was of deo&rrot;kce&slong;tre Deorkcestre &punctelev; biside Oxenfo&rrot;de iwis
Sethþe hadde þe king of þe March &punctelev; Notinghamschire þerto
In þe bischop&rrot;iche of Euerwike &punctelev; bote þo nas it nouȝt so
Þo was al þis lond icleoped &punctelev; þe Marche of Walis
Of al þis seint kenelmes Kenelmes fader &punctelev; he was king iwis
Non of alle þe oþere kyneriches &punctelev; aȝein þis kinedom nas
And wynchecoumbe Wynchecoumbe of al þis lond &punctelev; chef Cite cite þo was
Þis fijf kyngues þat weren þo &punctelev; þat on was of kent Kent iwis
And þe oþer ase ich ou seide er &punctelev; of þe Marche of walis Walis
Of Esex[r. We&slong;tsex] and of No&rrot;thhomberlond &punctelev; and of e&slong;tlond Estlond also
Þis fijf kynedomes in engelond Engelond &punctelev; in þat time weren ido
Þe king of we&slong;tsex Westsex hadde þo &punctelev; al wilteschire Wilteschire iwis
And Deo&rrot;kece&slong;tre[al. Do&rrot;sete] and barrokeschire Barrokeschire &punctelev; þat al o bischop&rrot;iche is
To[al. om.] þe bischop&rrot;iche of salesburi Salesburi &punctelev; ake þo nas it so nouȝt[orig. nouȝt so]
Fo&rrot; þe chief &slong;tude of þe bischop&rrot;iche &punctelev; at schirbourne Schirbourne was iwrouȝt
Sethþe hadde þe kyng of we&slong;tsex Westsex &punctelev;
southsex Southsex also
Þe welde and al þe bischop&rrot;iche &punctelev; of Cice&slong;tre þerto
And southampteschire Southampteschire and soþereye Soþereye &punctelev; þat of þe[r. o] bischop&rrot;iche is
Þe bischop&rrot;iche of wynche&slong;tre Wynchestre &punctelev; þat ȝuyt is þere iwis
And somersete Somersete [þat] to welles &punctelev; þulke tyme d&rrot;ouȝ
Nov it is þe bischop&rrot;iche of baþe Baþe &punctelev; ȝe schullen iwyten.[al. ȝe witeþ wel inouȝ][vv. 634 are transp. in the MS.]
¶Þe kyng of we&slong;tsex Westsex hadde sethþe &punctelev; al deueneschire Deueneschire iwis
And Co&rrot;nwaile þat in þe bischop&rrot;iche &punctelev; of Ecce&slong;tre nouþe is
Þe king of kent Kent was þo kyng &punctelev; of al þe londe of
kent Kent
Þat weren inne tweie bischop&rrot;iches &punctelev; and ȝeot nis it nouȝt iwent
Þe bischop&rrot;iche of Caunterburi &punctelev; þat in Engelonde ȝeot is hext
And þe bischop&rrot;iche of Rouce&slong;tre &punctelev; þat inþe we&slong;tside is next
Þe king þat was of a&slong;tlonde Astlonde &punctelev; king was of No&rrot;thfolk
Þe bischop&rrot;iche of No&rrot;thwich &punctelev; and also of southfolk Southfolk
And al þe bischop&rrot;iche of hely Hely &punctelev; þat þe Yle of hely Hely ȝeot is
And graunteb&rrot;uggeschire Grauntebruggeschire &punctelev; þareto fallez iwis
Seint Eadmund was of þat lond &punctelev; kyng bi olde dawe
Fo&rrot; he was in is owene lond &punctelev; fo&rrot; is guodnesse aslawe
Þe kyng of No&rrot;thhumberlond &punctelev; was kyng ich onder&slong;tonde
Of al þe londe biȝeonde houmber Houmber &punctelev; Anon into scotlonde Scotlonde
Þe bischop&rrot;iche of Eouerwik &punctelev; and of Duyrham iwis
Seint Oswold bi olde dawe &punctelev; was kyng of al þis
Þus manie kyngues weren &punctelev; ȝwylene in Engelonde
And heo&rrot;e londes departede weren &punctelev; þus ich under&slong;tonde
Þe kyng þat was of þe march March &punctelev; ase ich telle bigan
Kenulf kyng he was icleoped &punctelev; swiþe holi and guod man
Seint kenelm Kenelm was is sone &punctelev; and is eir also
Bo&rrot;ewenild and quend&rrot;ith Quendrith &punctelev; weren is douȝtrene two
In þe foureandtwentiþe ȝere &punctelev; of is kynedom
Þe kyng[on the margin.] kenulf deide &punctelev; and to þe IoIe ioie of heuene he com
hit was afftur þat o&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; in his moder aliȝte
Eiȝte hund&rrot;et ȝer and Nyntene &punctelev; bi acountes riȝte
¶Seint kenelm Kenelm is ȝonge sone &punctelev; In is seuenþe ȝere
kyng was Imad aftur him &punctelev; alþei he ȝong child were
his [o] so&slong;ter Bo&rrot;ewenild &punctelev; louede him inouȝ
And in eche manere &punctelev; to alle guodnesse heo d&rrot;ouȝ
Quend&rrot;ith þe oþur so&slong;ter &punctelev; of hire maneres nas nouȝt
Fo&rrot; heo to&rrot;nede to feolonie &punctelev; and[orig. ant] to quede hire þouȝt
¶heo isaiȝ þat hire ȝungue b&rrot;oþer &punctelev; þat nas nouȝt of seue ȝer
kyng was imad of al þat lond &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e fader hadde er
to him heo hadde gret onde &punctelev; þat he scholde so riche beo
And eir of hire fader lond &punctelev; and of mo&rrot;e power þane heo
heo þouȝte ȝif heo miȝte b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; þis child of lijfdawe
Þat heo wolde of is heritage &punctelev; beo quene with lawe
Al hire þouȝt was niȝt and day &punctelev; to biþenche sum outrage
Þat þis child were ib&rrot;ouȝt of dawe &punctelev; fo&rrot;to habbe is heritage
heo po&rrot;ueide hire riȝt feolonliche &punctelev; A poysun &slong;trong inouȝ
Fo&rrot;to ȝiue þis ȝongue child &punctelev; to slen him with wouȝ
Þo þat poysun him was iȝiue &punctelev; þat so &slong;trong and luþer was
Ore louerdes miȝte was so muche &punctelev; þat noþe wo&rrot;se him nas
Þo þe luþere quene þat isai &punctelev; þat hit was al fo&rrot; nouȝt
Þat no poysun ne miȝte him sle &punctelev; heo þouȝte an oþur þouȝt
Þis ȝongue child ane mai&slong;ter hadde &punctelev; þat his wardein was
Askebert he was icleoped &punctelev; a &slong;trong trichour alas
Fo&rrot; noman ne may to oþur &punctelev; sonere tricherie do
Þane þilke þat is him euere neiȝ &punctelev; and þat he tri&slong;t me&slong;t to
¶Þis luþere quene biþouȝte hire &punctelev; of one false wrenche
Men seith þat feolonie nas neuere non &punctelev; þat womman ne can biþenche
with þis Askebert heo spac &punctelev; þis child to slen and spille
heo bihet him mede and guod inovȝ &punctelev; and of eche þing don is wille
So þat þis to luþere þingues &punctelev; weren at one rede
And bispeken hou huy miȝten be&slong;t &punctelev; don þe luþere dede
Þe ȝwyle huy bispeken boþe &punctelev; þis ȝongue child to quelle
Þis swete sweuene þis child matte &punctelev; þat ich ov wolle nouþe telle
him þouȝte þat þare &slong;tod a treo &punctelev; riȝt bifo&rrot;e is bedde
Þat anon to þe &slong;teo&rrot;rene it tilde &punctelev; and swyþe wide it sp&rrot;adde
Þis treo was fair and noble inovȝ &punctelev; And schon wel b&rrot;iȝte and wide
Ful of blo&slong;tmene and of fruyt &punctelev; and mani a riche bouȝ biside
berninde wex and laumpes also &punctelev; þicke b&rrot;enninde and liȝte
So noble treo nas neuere iseiȝe &punctelev; ne non þat schon so b&rrot;iȝte
him þouȝte he c[l]am[MS. cam] opon þat treo &punctelev; to þexte bowe an heiȝ
And biheold aboute into al þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; and aperteliche[al. p&rrot;ute inouȝ] iseiȝ
Þe ȝwyle he &slong;tod opon þis treo &punctelev; and biheold aboute so
him þouȝte þat on of is nexte frend &punctelev; and þat he tru&slong;te me&slong;t to
On þe grounde &slong;tod bineþe &punctelev; and smot ato þis treo
Þat it feol adoun to grounde &punctelev; þat deol it was to seo
to aluyte foul he[MS. ich] bicam &punctelev; non fairo&rrot;e ne miȝte non[om. non] beo
And bigan with Ioye inovȝ &punctelev; riȝt into heouene fleo
Þo þis child þouȝte so &punctelev; at wynchecombe Wynchcombe he lay
he awok and [in] grete þouȝte was &punctelev; boþe niȝt and day
he nu&slong;te ȝwat tockninge it was &punctelev; wel þe mo&rrot;e was his[MS. hire] þouȝt
Are he þarof sumþing wu&slong;te &punctelev; bliþe nas he nouȝt
his no&rrot;ice þat him hadde ifed &punctelev; and with hire milk fo&rrot;th ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þat child heo louede euere muche &punctelev; with dedes and with þouȝt
To hire þat child tri&slong;te me&slong;t &punctelev; woluene hire name was
Þis child tolde hire p&rrot;iueliche &punctelev; of is metingue al is cas
Þo þis No&rrot;ice norice hadde iheo&rrot;d &punctelev; þe sweuene þat was so guod
heo bigan to siche so&rrot;e &punctelev; and in grete þouȝte &slong;tod
Alas heo seide þat ich scholde &punctelev; euere þis day abide
Þat mi child mi swete heo&rrot;te &punctelev; swych cas schal bitide
Alas mi child mi swete fode &punctelev; þat ich habbe fo&rrot;th ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þi so&slong;ter þat[al. om.] bispekez þi deth &punctelev; to quelle þe heo hath iþouȝt
Ake þe foul þat þou bicome to &punctelev; and to heuene gan iwende
Þat was þi soule þat þudere schal &punctelev; aftur þi liues ende
Þis metyngue bicam soth inouȝ &punctelev; þat he fond atþe la&slong;te
Fo&rrot; is so&slong;ter and Askebert &punctelev; bispeken is deth wel fa&slong;te
Askebert seide a day &punctelev; þat þis child scholde wende
An hontingue to pleiȝen him &punctelev; bi þe wodes ende
And he with him ase hit was riȝt &punctelev; to witien him bi þe weiȝe
he[= heo huy] wende to þe wode of clent &punctelev; ase it were heom fo&rrot;to pleie
Ase huy wenden aboute þe wode &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þe grace
grete wille þat child hadde &punctelev; þare to slepen in one place
Adoun he lai wel soffteliche &punctelev; and gan to slepe anon
Askebert ne þouȝte nouȝt &punctelev; þat he scholde þannes gon
biside in one derne &slong;tude &punctelev; he gan to deluen fa&slong;te
Ane put ȝwane þat child were ded &punctelev; þareinne him to ca&slong;te
Þat child bigan awakien sone &punctelev; ase þei it were bi cas
After is mai&slong;ter he biheold &punctelev; and ne saiȝ nouȝt ȝware he was
Ake o&rrot;e louerd him ȝaf þe grace &punctelev; þei he nu&slong;te nouȝt of is dede
Þat he spac to his mai&slong;ter &punctelev; and þeos wo&rrot;des sede
Þou trauaile&slong;t he seide aboute nouȝt &punctelev; and þine ȝwyle þou do&slong;t spille
Fo&rrot; in ane oþure &slong;tude i schal deie &punctelev; ȝware hit is godes Godes wille
And þo&rrot;uȝ tokningue of þis ȝeo&rrot;de &punctelev; þou schal wel iseo
Þare[al. whane] al þi wille þou miȝt do &punctelev; þat ich imartred beo
Fo&rrot;th wende þis luþere man &punctelev; and þis child also
huy comen to on oþur &slong;tude &punctelev; þare þe dede was ido
Þis mai&slong;ter nam þe ȝeo&rrot;de &punctelev; and sette hire on þe grounde
And heo bigan to leui þare &punctelev; in wel luyte &slong;tounde
And a swyþe gret Asch bicam sethþe &punctelev; and ȝeot &slong;tant in þulke place
to schewi þe miȝte of seint kenelm Kenelm &punctelev; and o&rrot;e louerdes grace
Þes luþere man nam þis child &punctelev; in þe wode of klent
And ladde him ase men doth a þeof &punctelev; to afongue is Iuggement
he ladde him into a p&rrot;iue &slong;tude &punctelev; al out of þe weiȝe
bitwene [twei][om.] hulles heiȝe &punctelev; into a deop ualeie
¶Þis child þo&rrot;uȝ þe holi go&slong;t &punctelev; þei þe oþur it nolde him telle
Wu&slong;te wel is luþere þouȝt &punctelev; þat he him wolde aquelle
And þo he targede a luyte &punctelev; þis luþere dede to done
Þat child seide wel mildeliche &punctelev; ȝwy ne do&slong;t þou sone?
he bigan Ane saume þat men singuth &punctelev; in holie churche aday
Þat was te deum laudamus &punctelev; are þat he adoun lay
Riȝt ase he scide an holi vers &punctelev; þat þareinne was and is
Alatyn iwrite as alle þe oþure &punctelev; and þe englisch Englisch so is þis
Þe faire compaygnie of Martyrs &punctelev; louerd herieth þe
Riȝt ase he hadde þat fers iseid &punctelev; as þe boc tellez me
Þe luþere man smot of is heued &punctelev; onder an hawȝþo&rrot;ntreo
Þare ase godes Godes wille was &punctelev; þat he imartred scholde beo
A coluere ȝwiȝt so eni milk &punctelev; out of him gan teo
And riȝt euene heo was iseiȝe &punctelev; into heouene fleo
Onneþe he was seue ȝer old &punctelev; are he imartred were
Alto soth is sweuene was &punctelev; ase [men] miȝten iseo þere
¶Þis luþere man þat him aslovȝ &punctelev; bigan to delue fa&slong;te
And made ane put deop inouȝ &punctelev; and þareinne þis child ca&slong;te
he burede hit þare fa&slong;te inou &punctelev; þat he ifounde nere
And wende hom aȝein in is wei &punctelev; and liet him ligge þere
To Quend&rrot;ith his luþere so&slong;ter &punctelev; anonriȝt he gan iwende
And tolde al þis luþere dede &punctelev; hou he was ib&rrot;ouȝt to ende
Þeos womman was þo glad inouȝ &punctelev; Aboute heo sende anon
Fo&rrot;to saisi alle his londes to hire &punctelev; and þe maneres euerechon
And liet hire makien quiene of þe Marche &punctelev; ase hire b&rrot;oþur was king
A schrewe lauedi heo was inovȝ &punctelev; and wicke þo&rrot;uȝ alle þing
heo wende aboute ope al hire lond &punctelev; and nam hire manrede[orig. manrade]
And bicam &slong;tuyrne and biladde hire men &punctelev; harde with muche wrechhede.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
heo liet hote into al þat lond &punctelev; þat no man so wod nere
to nemmen hire b&rrot;oþer name &punctelev; fo&rrot; loue ne fo&rrot; fere
And ȝif man miȝte ani iwite &punctelev; þat nadde it nouȝt bileued
Þat he were sone inome &punctelev; and ismiten of is heued
Þus fierde þis luþere womman &punctelev; and &slong;turede hire wel fa&slong;te
Þat no man ne do&rrot;&slong;te hire b&rrot;oþur bimene &punctelev; huy weren so so&rrot;e aga&slong;te
And euere lai þis holie bodi &punctelev; ibured swiþe &slong;tille
Þat no man ne do&rrot;&slong;te of him speke &punctelev; aȝein þe quiene wille
So longue þat he was al fo&rrot;ȝite &punctelev; þo men ne mo&slong;te of him speke
Ake hit nas nouȝt þat atþe la&slong;te &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd him nolde awreke
Þane no man nolde þat witti was &punctelev; of him þenchen ene
Ore louerd nolde nouȝt þat he were &punctelev; allingues fo&rrot;ȝite so clene
Ȝwane no man þat witti was &punctelev; of him ne hadde muynde
A doumb be&slong;t þat is withoute witte &punctelev; hadde aȝein kuynde
Fo&rrot; a wydewe hadde ane ȝwite kov &punctelev; þat wonede þarebiside
Þat ȝeode adai to fetten hire mete &punctelev; in þe wode wel wide
Þo seint kenelm Kenelm was ibured &punctelev; in þe valeie þare doune
Þis kou wolde eche daye &punctelev; ȝwane heo come fram toune
to gaderi hire mete with oþure kuyn &punctelev; heo wolde gon al one
Fer adoun into þis valeie &punctelev; and hire felawes bileue echone
And sitte bi þis holie bodi &punctelev; al þe longue dai
Ase it were fo&rrot;to honouri him &punctelev; fo&rrot; hit so one lay
And so heo sat withoute mete &punctelev; al þe day to þen ende
And ȝwane hit atþe eue was &punctelev; hamward heo wolde wende
Ȝwane heo cam hom at eue &punctelev; fair and round heo was
And swyþe Mielch also &punctelev; þat was a wonder cas
Fo&rrot; þare ne was no oþur kov &punctelev; þat half so muche milk ȝeoue
heo ne ȝaf amo&rrot;ewe noþe lasse &punctelev; þei heo were imilked an eue.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Folk þat þis wonder isaiȝ &punctelev; guode ȝeme alle huy nome
And awaiteden wel a dai &punctelev; ȝware þe kou bicome
Heo seien hire sitte al þe day &punctelev; in þe valeie þare doune
Stille in one &slong;tude meteles &punctelev; fo&rrot;to heo eode an eue to toune
Ake ȝwi heo sete þare so &punctelev; heo ne miȝten iwite noþing
bote in heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;te huy onder&slong;toden &punctelev; þat it was sum tokning
Fo&rrot; þis kov wonede so þere &punctelev; and adai d&rrot;ouȝ hire þareto
Þe ualeye men cleopeden koubache Koubache &punctelev; and ȝeot men doth also
In kovbache Kovbache þat holie bodi &punctelev; lai wel mani a ȝer
Þat men nu&slong;ten of him noþing &punctelev; ase ich ov seide er
Fo&rrot; is so&slong;ter þat was so fo&rrot;th[al. fers &punctelev; and] &punctelev; in grete p&rrot;uyte ib&rrot;ouȝt
So gret þretningue fo&rrot; him heo made &punctelev; þat men ne do&rrot;&slong;ten him nemme nouȝt
Þo þis bodi ne mo&slong;te beo &punctelev; ifounde in Engelonde
Ore louerd þat wot alle þing &punctelev; to him he sende is sonde.[al. þerto sette is honde]
Ase þe pope &slong;tod at rome Rome &punctelev; in his masse a day
At seint peteres Seint Peteres weouede &punctelev; ase muche folk þat isai
A coluere ȝwiȝt so ani snov &punctelev; cam fram heouene fleo
And leide on þe weuede a luyte writ &punctelev; and sethþe aȝen gan &slong;teo
he flevȝ op into heouene an heiȝ &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd it wolde
Þat writ was ȝwijt and schon wel b&rrot;iȝte &punctelev; þe lettres weren of golde
Þe pope þonkede ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; and þat folk dude also
he nam þe lettre on his hond &punctelev; and þo heo was ondo
he nu&slong;te ȝwat it was to segge &punctelev; ne non insiȝt he ne couþe iwite
Fo&rrot; he ne couþe englisch Englisch non &punctelev; and on englis it was iwrite
he liet cleopie echemanere men &punctelev; of eche diuerse londe
ȝif any covþe of þis holie writ &punctelev; Aniþing onder&slong;tonde
Þo weren þare men of Engelonde &punctelev; þat wu&slong;ten ȝwat it sede
And onder&slong;toden wel þat writ &punctelev; þo heo iheo&rrot;den it rede
¶Þat writ was puyr on Englisch iwrite &punctelev; ase men it radden þere
And fo&rrot;to tellen withoute ryme &punctelev; þeos wo&rrot;des it were
In klent covbache kenelm Kenelm kyngues sone[al. bern] lijth onder ane þo&rrot;ne is[al. om.] heued him[al. om.] bireued
Þis writ was wel nobleliche &punctelev; iwu&slong;t and up ido
And iholde fo&rrot; gret relike &punctelev; and ȝeot it is also
Þe noble&slong;te relike it is on þarof &punctelev; þat is in þe churche of rome Rome
So it ouȝte wel hoso it under&slong;tode &punctelev; fram ȝwanne þat it come
Fo&rrot; ȝwane it out of heouene cam &punctelev; fram o&rrot;e louerdes honde
Ȝwat noblere relike miȝte beo? &punctelev; Ine can non onder&slong;tonde
Þarefo&rrot;e seint kenelmes Kenelmes day &punctelev; ase þe pope makede is he&slong;te
At rome Rome huy holdez heiȝliche &punctelev; and makiez wel heiȝ fe&slong;te
¶Þe pope þo he þe soþe wu&slong;te &punctelev; þat it was swuch tockningue
his messagers into Engelonde &punctelev; he sende wit þis tiþingue
To þe Erchebischope of kaunterburi Kaunterburi &punctelev;
wolfred Wolfred þat was þo
his lettre he sende þat he scholde &punctelev; of swuche þingue ondergo
And seche after þe wode of klent Klent &punctelev; ȝif ani man miȝte iwite
And seche ane þo&rrot;n in kovbache Kovbache &punctelev; ase it was in þe write
And fo&rrot;to seche þat holie bodi &punctelev; þat derneliche lay þere
And nimen it up with gret honour &punctelev; þat hit ischrined were
Þo þe lettre fram þe pope &punctelev; to þe Erchebischope cam
Of bischopes and of clerkus &punctelev; conseil þarof he nam
So þat in þe wode of klent Klent &punctelev; þat in wyrice&slong;treschire Wyricestreschire is
he liet seche þat holie bodi &punctelev; and fond it out iwis
Onder þe þo&rrot;ne at covbache Covbache &punctelev; ase þat writ seide of rome Rome
Fo&rrot; þe contreiemen biside &punctelev; manie þudere huy come[al. & fo&rrot; þe miracle of þe cou &punctelev; þe what|loker þerto hi come.]
Þo[al. Fo&rrot;] men of þarebiside &punctelev; onderȝeten[al. þat o.] þat cas
Ortreweden wel ȝware it lay &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe miracle so fair was
Anon so þat bodi was op inome &punctelev; þe ȝwile þat folk þare &slong;tod
Þere sp&rrot;ong a welle þare he lay &punctelev; þat ȝeot is fair and guod
A welle þare is cler inouȝ &punctelev; and eucreft hath ibeo
In þe &slong;tude þare he lai on &punctelev; ase man mai þare iseo
Men[al. þat me] cleopieth seint kenelmes Kenelmes welle &punctelev; þat mani man hath isouȝt
And manie þo&rrot;uȝ þe watere &punctelev; of grete Anguisse anguisse beoth ib&rrot;ouȝt
Of þe cite of wynchecumbe Wynchecumbe &punctelev; and of þe contreie þarebiside
Þe men weren þat souȝten so &punctelev; þat holie bodi so wide
And[al. fo&rrot;] þe bischopes hadden er iloked &punctelev; þat it scholde to winchecumbe Winchecumbe beo ibo&rrot;e
And ischrined þare is fader lai &punctelev; þat arerde þat hous bifo&rrot;e
Þis men nomen up þat holie bodi &punctelev; þat of glouce&slong;treschire Gloucestreschire were
And nobleliche toward wynchecumbe Wynchecumbe &punctelev; with p&rrot;ocession it bere
Þat folk of wyrice&slong;treschire Wyricestreschire &punctelev; þat woneden þarebiside
Nomen heom to rede manie &punctelev; to maken þat bodi abide
And swo&rrot;en þat huy it wolden habbe &punctelev; and noman ne scholde it heom bireue
Fo&rrot; in þe schire þare it ifounde was &punctelev; huy seiden it scholde bileue
bi þe watere of pirefo&rrot;d Pireford &punctelev; þis two schirene hem mette
And conteckeden fo&rrot; þis holie bodi &punctelev; and fa&slong;te togadere sette
So þat huy nomen ane fourme of pays &punctelev; to don bi[al. vp]
godes Godes grace
Ȝif god God heom wolde is wille sch[e]wen &punctelev; are huy wenden fram þat place
Feo&rrot; huy weren itrauailed and so&rrot;e &punctelev; so þat heom lu&slong;te slepe echon
huy maden ane fourme þat huy scholden alle &punctelev; ligge slepe anon
And ȝweþur of þis twei schires &punctelev; miȝten sono&rrot;e awake
huy scholden sauf inovȝ wenden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and þat bodi with hem[MS. him] take
¶Stille huy leiȝen slepe fa&slong;te &punctelev; þis schirene boþeto
And re&slong;ten heom of ho&rrot;e werienesse &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd it wolde so
[So] þat huy of glouce&slong;treschire Gloucestreschire &punctelev; awoken sone echon
At one tyme alle ase god God it wolde &punctelev; and of wyrice&slong;treschire Wyricestreschire nouȝt on
In pais huy wenden fo&rrot;th heo&rrot;e wey &punctelev; and þis bodi with heom toke
Wel fif mile wei huy weren iwende &punctelev; are þe oþere awoke
Þis oþere iseiȝen heom bigylede &punctelev; anon so huy bigounne awake
And siweden þis oþere swiþe fa&slong;te &punctelev; ake huy ne miȝten heom nouȝt oftake
Þis men toward wychecombe Wynchecombe &punctelev; þat holie bodi huy bere
Are heo miȝten it þudere b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; swyþe werie huy were
So þat huy comen into one wode &punctelev; a luyte bi e&slong;te þe toune
And re&slong;ten heom þo huy weren so neiȝ &punctelev; opon ane heiȝe doune
Aþur&slong;t huy weren fo&rrot; werienesse &punctelev; so þat it nas non ende
huy beden o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; seint kenelmes Kenelmes loue &punctelev; þat he scholde heom d&rrot;inke sende
A fair welle þare sp&rrot;ong op &punctelev; an heiȝ opon þe doune
Þat ȝuyt is þare cler and cold &punctelev; half a mile fram toune
heo is nouþe wel faire iheoled &punctelev; with freo &slong;ton ase riȝt is
Iredi ech man to d&rrot;inken of &punctelev; þat cometh þarefo&rrot;th iwis
¶Þe Monekes of Wynchecombe &punctelev; arerd habbez þarebiside
A fair chapele of seint kenelm Kenelm &punctelev; þat men sechez ful wide
Quend&rrot;ith þe luþere womman &punctelev; at wynchecumbe Wynchecumbe þo was
bote heo nu&slong;te nouȝt hire b&rrot;oþer so neiȝ &punctelev; ne nowiȝt of þat cas
In seint peteres Seint Peteres churche heo sat &punctelev; biside þe Abbeie abbeie ȝate
In a soler inþe e&slong;tside &punctelev; and lokede out þareate
heo isaiȝ al þis grete folk come &punctelev; adoneward of þe doune heiȝe
Toward wychecumbe Wynchecumbe &punctelev; aluyte fram suydleiȝe
heo Axede ȝwat men it weren &punctelev; and ȝwat huy þouȝten þere
Men seiden þat huy to churche wolden &punctelev; and þat huy hire b&rrot;oþer bere
Þo was þis Quiene so&rrot;i inovȝ &punctelev; in grete deole and fere
hire sauter heo nam on honde &punctelev; ase þei heo witles were
Of þe sauter þe la&slong;te saume &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe Euesongus iwis
of co&rrot;singue and[al. om.] of luþere men &punctelev; and of mansingue imaked heo is
Deus laudem [heo] is icleoped. &punctelev; þis saume þe Quiene radde
Fo&rrot;to aco&rrot;si hire b&rrot;oþur bodi &punctelev; and alle þat him þudere ladde
Þo heo cam to þe Ninteoþe vers &punctelev; ase þe mansingue endez iwis
Þat hoc opus eo&rrot;um &punctelev; alatin icleoped it is
Þat seit þat[al. what] men it beo scholden &punctelev; þat duden[al. afongeþ] þat ilke dede
Opon hire owene heued it cam &punctelev; ase heo þat vers gan rede
Fo&rrot; riȝt ase heo þat vers radde &punctelev; outbo&rrot;&slong;ten boþe hire eiȝe
And fullen adoun opon hire sauter &punctelev; ase manie men iseiȝe.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Þe sauter is ȝuyt at wynchecombe Wynchcombe &punctelev; and hoso come wole þareto
Aperteliche man may þare ise &punctelev; ȝware þe dede was ido.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Þis holie bodi was fo&rrot;th ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; with gret honour ate fine
And in þe Abbeie abbeie þare he lijth ȝuyt &punctelev; idon in wel noble schrine
Þis luþere Quiene deide sethþe &punctelev; in schrewedenesse inouȝ
Þat bodi ase a co&rrot;sede wrechche &punctelev; into ane diche man it d&rrot;ovȝ
Into þe foule&slong;te þat was þare aboute &punctelev; and þareinne man it slong
bote hire endingue sunful[al. scenfol] were &punctelev; me þinchez elles it hadde ibeo wrong
Nov god God fo&rrot; þe loue of seint kenelm Kenelm &punctelev; is swete grace vs[MS. it] sende
Þat we moten to þulke Ioie &punctelev; þare he is inneiwiende. AmeN Amen
